I'm so sick of hearing about how Tesla knew about induction and free energy.  GUESS WHAT, induction is a very simple electrical property discovered by FARADAY well before Tesla was born.  And, the induction coil was invented by Nicholas Callan in 1836, also well before Tesla was born.  Tesla did not design the first AC generator - many 2 phase generators were used in Europe, and after the more efficient 3-phase generator was designed only a few years later Tesla stayed stuck in his less efficient 2-phase system.  Tesla's theories on free energy (and "grabbing energy from the air" had nothing to do with induction coils, it involved using the Earth's ground as an infinite source of negatively charged ions, and cosmic rays as a force to get the electrons to flow - a system no engineer to date has been able to successfully implement.  Don't get me wrong, he was an amazing man - a true genius in electrical engineering.  It's just ridiculous the claims made that he was a wizard, and the misattributed discoveries.  If you're really interested in engineering and science (and not fooled by the media's portrayal of the Edison/Tesla conflict,) I recommend visiting the  Deutsches Museum in Munich where many of the original first motors and dynamos are on display with accurate listings of attributions
